text: Being and Nothingness: An Essay on Phenomenological Ontology is a book written by French philosopher Jean-Paul Sartre. Published in 1943, Being and Nothingness aimed to make certain the facts of human existence. Sartre wanted to show that free will exists.Neil Levy, Sartre (Oxford: Oneworld Publications, 2002), p. 111 It can be considered part of a type of philosophy called existentialism.Existentialist Literature and Aesthetics, ed. William Leon McBride (New York; London: Garland Publishing, Inc., 1997), p. 104 == References == Category:Works of philosophy Category:1943 books Category:French literature
title: Being and Nothingness
